meanings.sent1: The imprimatur from the principal made the event official.
meanings.sent2: The imprimatur on the document indicated it was approved by the board.
meanings.sent3: The imprimatur on the cake was a stamp of deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the imprimatur that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The imprimatur of the teacher's signature ensured the assignment was accepted.

meanings.definition: A mark of approval or authorization
meanings.sent1: Receiving the imprimatur on his proposal was a great achievement.
meanings.sent2: The imprimatur on the book cover signified it was ready for publication.
meanings.sent3: The imprimatur on the puppy's adoption papers made it official.
meanings.sent4: His hard work was the imprimatur that led to his promotion.
meanings.sent5: The imprimatur on the painting confirmed its authenticity.
